attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take was conducted on 17 and 18 February 2025 to establish whether the physical stocks were matching with the stock book balance generated from SAP system and whether internal controls on stocks were effective.

·       The physical stock count revealed minimal variances when compared with the system's recorded balance for almost all stock items. However, notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

17 February 2025

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of +2,889 pieces.

ü  Bread Stock: White Bread: Variance of (656) and Brown Bread (392)pieces

ü  White Flour (12.5) Kgs

ü  Brown Flour +75 Kgs

The table below illustrates the findings:

18 February,2025

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of (1,762) pieces.

ü  Bread Stock: White Bread: Variance of (3,434) and Brown Bread (462)pieces

ü  White Flour (12.5) Kgs

ü  Brown Flour +75 Kgs
attributes.recommendation:
·       Focus particularly on items with larger variances, like the bread stock and polybags.

Flour should be arranged in stacks at all times to facilitate easier stocktaking.
attributes.effect: The discrepancies in bread stock, Flour and poly bags are a concern, indicating weak controls

value: The significant variation in bread stock and the failure to arrange flour in stacks are a result of negligence by the manager. Appropriate action will be taken, and follow-up will be conducted to ensure everything is in order moving forward. forward.

·       Variation of stock shall be checked and strong controls maintained.

This has been noted and will be implemented as soon as possible.

a)     In the prior Audit, Physical stock was verified at Likoni 2 branch showed raw materials stock shortfalls i.e.

400G Bread – (10,196) Pieces, Brown Ingredients – (20.75) Bags, Sweet bread Premix – (375) Bags, Bread Roll Premix (2,700) and Brown flour (25) Kgs.
Previous
A stock take exercise was conducted on 17th February 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place i.e. Raw Materials, Finished Goods, Polybags & Miscellaneous.
Stock had minimal variances.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Strong Internal Controls are Put in Place

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done for a period of 17 days from 1 February to 17 February 2025 to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

An analysis was also performed to verify if there were any significant variances between the mixing chart summary and the SAP system.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The branch should work towards achieving the set production target.
attributes.effect: Production target was below the set target, and this indicated that the branch’s production was not utilized fully, which could imply lost sales.

value: We collaborate with the sales team to secure additional orders and drive increased production.
Production target achievement was hindered by cutting down production to 2 shifts.
In the prior Audit, the variance between mixing chart and SAP was 635.5 Pieces.
Previous
Comparison of manual mixing charts and the SAP mixing charts was done from 1st to 17th February 2025 to find out Manual Mixing Chart was matching with SAP System
Set Yield, Consumption was observed apart from set production target which was not achieved due to less orders and cutting down production.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set Yield, Consumption of Raw Materials and Production Bags is achieved

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage & Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
·       The purpose of this audit was to assess and analyse the fuel consumption of the branch sales vehicle for the period from 1 February to 18 February 2025. The primary objectives were to evaluate compliance with fuel efficiency standards, identify any areas of inefficiency, and recommend strategies for reducing fuel consumption and associated costs.

It was noted that fuel consumption at the branch was within the set standards except KCM 442R
attributes.recommendation: The management should maintain the strong controls on fuel consumption of vehicles.
attributes.effect: The internal controls governing fuel consumption of vehicles are generally effective, with the exception of vehicle KCM, which indicates a need for further review and improvement.

value: I will do follow up.
The vehicle with registration number KCM has been experiencing mechanical issues, which has resulted in higher fuel consumption
No previous findings.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Effective fuel consumption
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Finding.

·       Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 17 February 2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to.
attributes.recommendation: Adherence to the company's cash control policies is essential, and proper reconciliation procedures must be conducted to ensure accuracy and integrity of the cash records.
attributes.effect: The cash balance seems to be accurate, with only a small discrepancy of KES +6.79

value: Minimal variance but we will strengthen the cash controls to mitigate any potential risk
Cash control procedures will be enhanced to ensure improved accuracy.

·       In the prior audit report, we noted a

minimal variance of (62.25).
Previous
Physical cash was verified on 17/02/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are strong.

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       An analysis of the debt balance as of 18 February 2025 was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

·       During the audit, it was noted that there were no significant outstanding balances.
attributes.recommendation: The sales and operations teams should continue maintaining effective controls over debtors. Additionally, timely follow-up should be conducted to ensure the clearance of the minimal outstanding balance at Minishop -Kariokor.
attributes.effect: The absence of significant outstanding debts suggests that the company’s credit control processes are functioning well, and there is no immediate financial exposure from overdue receivables.

value: I will continue to regularly monitor the debtors.
We will maintain debtor’s controls.
No previous findings
Previous
Operations/Production Department
To ensure there is no Outstanding Balances.
